feed.title: Current Watches, Warnings and Advisories for the United States Issued by the National Weather Service

entry.title: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 20 at 7:35PM AKST until December 20 at 9:00PM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM AKST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Light freezing rain occurring. A light glaze of ice is expected. * WHERE...Upper Koyukuk Valley. * WHEN...Until 9 PM today.

entry.title: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 20 at 7:35PM AKST until December 21 at 12:00PM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON AKST TUESDAY... * WHAT...Snow occuring, and blowing snow with low visibility expected. Snow accumulation 4 to 6 inches. Blowing snow will cause visibility to fall to one half mile or less at times. * WHERE...Along the Alaska Highway. * WHEN...Until noon Tuesday.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Upper Tanana Valley and the Fortymile Country

entry.title: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 20 at 7:35PM AKST until December 21 at 6:00PM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM AKST TUESDAY... * WHAT...Snow and blowing snow with low visibility occurring. Plan on difficult travel conditions. Additional snow accumulations of 2 to 4 inches, are expected. Visibility will be less than one half mile at times.

entry.title: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 20 at 4:26PM AKST until December 20 at 9:00PM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM AKST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Snow, mixed with freezing rain at times. entry.summary: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 AM AKST TUESDAY... * WHAT...Snow. Additional snow accumulations of 4 to 8 inches. Highest amounts are expected across East Anchorage, the Hillside, Eagle River and the Glenn Highway corridor. * WHERE...Anchorage.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued December 20 at 1:50PM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...Snow and gusty winds tonight... Snow will move into the area this evening with 2 to 4 inches of additional accumulation. West to northwest winds will increase to 5 to 15 mph with gusts to 25 mph. Gusty winds may blow snow off trees, or blow trees laden with snow, on to power lines creating power outages.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Central Interior; Deltana and Tanana Flats; Denali; Eastern Alaska Range; Middle Tanana Valley

entry.summary: ...A High Surf Advisory remains in effect... * SURF...Surfs of 9 to 11 feet will impact all shores of American Samoa due to a long period (>15 seconds) northwest swell. * TIMING...through this evening. * IMPACTS...High surfs and strong rip currents Fautuaga mo galu maualuluga

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued December 20 at 3:04PM PST by NWS
entry.summary: ...WINTER WEATHER WILL RESULT IN MAJOR TRAVEL DISRUPTIONS MID WEEK THROUGH THE HOLIDAY WEEKEND... A series of Pacific winter storms will bring periods of stormy weather to much of California and Nevada this week. There will be few meaningful breaks in the weather for the Sierra once the storms begin late Tuesday so plan ahead.

entry.title: Winter Storm Watch issued December 20 at 2:52PM PST until December 23 at 4:00PM PST by NWS
entry.summary: ...WINTER STORM WATCH NOW IN EFFECT FROM LATE TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY AFTERNOON ABOVE 4000 FEET... * WHAT...Heavy snow possible above 4000 feet. Total snow accumulations of 8 to 12 inches possible with localized amounts up to 24 inches over higher remote terrain. Winds could gust as high as 50 mph over exposed terrain.

entry.title: Winter Storm Watch issued December 20 at 2:52PM PST until December 23 at 4:00PM PST by NWS

entry.summary: ...AN AIR QUALITY ADVISORY HAS BEEN ISSUED BY THE IDAHO DEPARTMENT OF ENVIRONMENTAL QUALITY... entry.summary: ...AREAS OF DENSE FOG LATER TONIGHT... Fog will develop late tonight into Tuesday morning...mainly along and south of a Watseka to Springfield line. The fog may become locally dense. entry.summary: ...WINTER WEATHER WILL RESULT IN MAJOR TRAVEL DISRUPTIONS MID WEEK THROUGH THE HOLIDAY WEEKEND... entry.title: Hydrologic Outlook issued December 20 at 9:58AM PST by NWS
entry.summary: ..THREAT OF RIVER FLOODING WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY FOR THE SKOKOMISH RIVER IN MASON COUNTY... Heavy rain over the south slopes of the Olympics Tuesday night through Wednesday night could drive the Skokomish River in Mason county above flood stage around Wednesday night. Rainfall totals of 2-3 inches are expected during this time over the south slopes of

entry.title: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 20 at 9:31PM CST until December 21 at 6:00PM CST by NWS
entry.summary: ...SNOW EXPECTED TO RESULT IN HAZARDOUS TRAVEL CONDITIONS TUESDAY... .A fast-moving weather system will bring snow to the area Tuesday. The snow will begin by mid-morning and then taper off during the afternoon. A total accumulation of 2 to 5 inches is expected across northern Wisconsin, with the highest totals near the Upper Michigan border.
